history.content: Really just depends - I know a lot of people who only did 61C over the summer and found it to be quite time-consuming, but I also know someone who had a full-time remote internship while taking it. As an average student in terms of study habits, I'd say I had most nights/weekends free, except during project days and before exams. I think I spent maybe 4 to 5 nights on the CPU project, about 2/3 on each of the other three projects, and would study for 2 or 3 days before the exams. So, altogether not an overwhelming commitment that I had time for nothing else. If you're someone who likes to start studying 10 days before the exams (which is hard to do during the summer), then expect to spend a lot more time on the class. Note that the first week or two can be rough if it's your first exposure to a C-like language.

Any advice for taking CS61C in the summer now that it is online? By then I'll have completed 61A B and 70 as well as some data science classes. How much free time should I expect each week if I want to pursue some side projects as well? Thanks in advance
history.subject: CS61C in Summer
